incidents.name: Errors When Using SendGrid API and making DNS request to api.sendgrid.com

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have been monitoring system performance and it appears to be operational now. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 5:15 PM PT on August 30th, our engineers began investigating an issue with errors being reported when using api.sendgrid.com. Some users may experience timeouts and server errors when connecting to SendGrid API or using the user interface via app.sendgrid.com. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Reseller IBM accounts experiencing Mail Send API and SMTP issues

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with selected IBM Resellers experiencing mail send issues with API and SMTP due to Sender Verification has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers deployed a change to the internal settings for sender verification, selected IBM resellers customers should now be able to send emails via API and SMTP.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are looking into the issue, and we will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 03:00 AM PDT on 25 August 2023, our engineers have began investigating an issue with mail send requests for SMTP or API. IBM customers may experience issues with mail send requests. This does impact mail send. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Errors When Using SendGrid API and User Interface Systems

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the deployed fix and confirmed the problems with the data center have been resolved. All services are operating normally at this time.

Our engineering team deployed a change to the internal system associated with the data center that was affected with the aforementioned errors. The deployment occurred at 3:55 PM PT and this change showed health improvements in functionality of non-mail send API and user interface resources for the affected SendGrid systems. After this deploy, both API and user interface errors are showing to be reduced. We are continuing to monitor for stability over the next hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 2:38 PM PT on August 24th, our engineers began investigating an issue with errors being reported with one of our data centers. Users may experience timeouts and server errors when connecting the SendGrid API or using the user interface via app.sendgrid.com. This includes errors when trying to access the SendGrid login page as well as API responses including 5XX type errors and "internal server error" with valid request information. This did impact mail send for both web API and SMTP, but a deploy was made at 2:45 PM PT to fix the delays in mail sending.  Problems with the user interface as well as other non-mail send API connectivity is still being investigated. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Marketing Campaigns Inaccessible

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the outage and confirmed the issue with Marketing Campaigns, API endpoints, and with our support portal has been resolved. Single Sends and Automations are sending emails, and previously queued emails from these products will be sent out. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers are continuing to monitor signs of recovery. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are observing signs of recovery and functionality to the affected products. Users may no longer experience issues when navigating the Marketing Campaigns product, no longer see errors with our API, and may be able to create support tickets. Our engineering team is continuing to monitor the signs of recovery. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue to be caused by an outage with a third-party provider. Our teams are working towards a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:08 PM PDT on Tuesday, June 13th our engineers began investigating an issue with customers using the Marketing Campaigns product. Users may receive errors when accessing and triggering Single Sends or Automations. Errors such as "Unable to retrieve your automations" may persist at this time. Users may also encounter errors with various API endpoints, and with submitting a support ticket. This does not impact Email API and SMTP mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Email Validations API Unavailable

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 1:13 PM PT on June 1st, our engineering team began investigating a problem related to SendGrid Email Validations API. Our team determined that this issue began at 10:13 AM PT and lasted through 1:29 PM PT, at which point a deploy was made to fix the problem. During the affected period, the SendGrid system began producing failures for attempts made to the Email Validations API endpoint for SendGrid. Users accessing this feature would have seen "403 FORBIDDEN" API response errors despite having proper permissions and feature access to this API endpoint. This did not impact mail send.  This issue has been resolved and systems are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Mail Send Delays

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 10:17 AM PT on May 31st, our engineering team began investigating a problem related to mail send delays for a subset of our users. The period of time for delayed mail send was between 9:50 AM PT and 11:50 AM PT, at which point mail successfully and completely dequeued from the system. This delay affected mail sent via SMTP, web API and Marketing Campaigns and affected approximately 20% of customer accounts. For any affected messages, the average queue time was approximately 5 minutes for the period. This issue has been resolved and mail sending systems are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Event Data Loss

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved identified issues surrounding event data loss. From April 21st 1:30 PM PST to April 24th 11:00 AM PST, approximately 0.08% of event data was lost. The event data includes all delivery events such as Processed, Delivered, Bounces and Blocks. The data lost during this time period is unrecoverable. This includes data within Stats, Email Activity, Expert Insights and the Event Webhook. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the Get Contact by Email API endpoint and Send A Test tool in Marketing Campaigns has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 1:13 PM PST on April 21st 2023, our engineers began investigating problems when retrieving data for the "Contacts by Emails" API resource. Users may be unable to use the "send test" functionality in the template engine or directly retrieve data at the "Contacts by Emails" API endpoint. This does not impact mail send beyond the aforementioned mail send test functionality. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermittent Mail Processing Delays and Timeouts

incident_updates.body: From 08:45 AM PDT to 09:05 AM PDT on March 23, 2023, we experienced an issue that may have affected processing times, and may have also resulted in connection time-outs to our servers. Potential impacts to users may include those that utilize the parseapi feature, as well as some "Forward Bounce" information.  Our engineers were able to quickly identify the issue and deploy a fix, and all systems are operating normally at this time. If you experienced degradation in service during this window, please contact Support.

We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at 3:15 AM PT on March 10th, our engineers began investigating a technical issue wherein the stats for the Campaigns sent using Marketing Campaigns Legacy were not being updated on the UI.
This only impacts stats functionality on Marketing Campaigns Legacy and does not affect mail send.

incidents.name: Heroku SendGrid Plan Change Failures

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the Heroku SendGrid plan fix and confirmed that subscription changes with this partner platform now function properly. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers identified the root cause for the problem that prevented proper plan changes for Heroku SendGrid subscriptions and implemented a fix. After testing plan changes for Heroku, these changes now operate as expected and the system is functioning properly. We will monitor the update for the next 30 minutes before confirming this as resolved.

Starting at 2:04 PM PT on March 9th, our engineers began investigating a technical issue in which users of the Heroku partner platform faced 500 errors when attempting to upgrade, downgrade or provision their SendGrid Heroku plans. This issue began at 4 AM PT on March 8th. This only impacts Heroku SendGrid subscription package changes and does not impact any other of our partner subscriptions. This issue does not affect mail send.  Another update will be provided as soon as more information is available or within the next hour.

incidents.name: Event Data Lost

incident_updates.body: Our engineers identified and investigated an issue related to the loss of event data stored within the Twilio SendGrid email platform for a subset of accounts. From February 16th 6:20 PM PST to February 23rd 3:30 AM PST, approximately 0.09% of event data was lost for affected accounts. Lost data was confirmed to have included deliverability events such as Processed, Delivered, and Blocks as well as engagement data such as Clicks and Opens. The data lost during this time period is unrecoverable. This includes data generated through aggregated Stats, the Email Activity, and the Event Notification Webhook. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Erroneous Login Failures

incident_updates.body: Between 11:28 AM PT and 12:00 PM PT, we experienced an issue that may have resulted in login failures and increased latency within the UI. SendGrid's ability to send mail during this time was not impacted. This issue has been resolved and customers should not see further erroneous login failures.
